title: Thyssenkrupp second quarter operating profit up on steel recovery
text:
May 15, 2018 / 5:17 AM / Updated 34 minutes ago Thyssenkrupp second quarter operating profit up on steel recovery Reuters Staff 2 Min Read
FRANKFURT (Reuters) - German technology and industrial conglomerate Thyssenkrupp ( TKAG.DE ) on Tuesday posted a 17-percent increase in its second-quarter operating profit, helped by a recovery in steel prices that has already benefited larger rival ArcelorMittal ( MT.AS ). FILE PHOTO: The logo of German steel-to-elevators group ThyssenKrupp AG is pictured during the company's annual news conference in Essen, Germany, November 24, 2016. REUTERS/Wolfgang Rattay/File Photo GLOBAL BUSINESS WEEK AHEAD
The group, which makes everything from submarines to chemical plants, said second-quarter adjusted earnings before interest and tax (EBIT) came in at 500 million euros (440 million pounds), in line with the average analyst forecast in a Reuters poll.
Profit at the group’s Steel Europe division, to be merged with the European steel unit of Indian peer Tata Steel ( TISC.NS ), more than doubled to 198 million euros, driven by a sharp recovery in prices so far this year.
ArcelorMittal, the world’s largest steelmaker, last week said the outlook for this year had improved, expecting higher demand for steel in machinery and construction amid solid expansion in the United States and Europe.
The steel joint venture with Tata Steel forms the core of Thyssenkrupp Chief Executive Heinrich Hiesinger’s plan to move the company away from the volatile steel sector and strengthen its focus on industrial goods, such as elevators and car parts.
The group’s struggling Industrial Solutions unit posted an operating loss of 23 million euros in the quarter. Thyssenkrupp said a turnaround plan initiated last year should lead to a significant increase in earnings in the second half. Reporting by Christoph Steitz; Editing by Edward Taylor and Maria Sheahan
